message.content: This question requires knowledge about the natural habitat and adaptation of polar bears. Polar bears have white fur which helps them blend in with the snowy environment of the Arctic. Therefore, they are less likely to be seen in places like Alaska, which have snowy landscapes. Option (A) is incorrect because a church is not a natural environment for polar bears and they would still be visible due to their size. Option (B) is also incorrect because even though polar bears may be kept in zoos, their white fur would still make them visible. Option (D) is incorrect because polar bears are not found in Africa.

This question tests knowledge about camouflage and the natural habitat of polar bears. Polar bears are well adapted to their Arctic habitat, which is characterized by snow and ice. Their white fur helps them blend in with the snowy environment, making them less visible. Option (A) is incorrect because a church is not a natural environment for polar bears. Option (B) is incorrect because in a zoo, polar bears are generally placed in habitats that resemble their natural environment, making them easier to see. Option (D) is incorrect because polar bears are not found in Africa.

Option (A) is incorrect because a church is not related to the natural habitat of a polar bear. Option (B) is incorrect because in a zoo, polar bears are usually displayed in an environment that mimics their natural habitat, making them easier to see.
